Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Wanted: A Robotics Technologist familiar with perception systems and methods, who possess strong software skills and familiarity with flight software, including implementation and best practices.

Members of this team investigate, architect, and develop perception capabilities in support of autonomy for systems ranging from small robots to spacecraft landing systems. Our work covers the full spectrum from basic research to mature hardware and software implementations on NASA flight projects. Included in this scope is autonomous navigation for terrestrial and planetary robots, mapping of planetary bodies from orbital data, and understanding of dynamic surface behavior from aerial and orbital imagery.

As a Robotics Technologist, you will be responsible for the following:

  • Development of perception algorithms for: (1) scene understanding, (2) recovery of scene geometry, (3) camera localization, (4) navigation.

  • Implementation of perception algorithms on robotic systems ranging from small, experimental robots to NASA flight systems.

Designated work includes:

  • Flight software support for the Cooperative Autonomous Distributed Robotic Exploration (CADRE) project

  • Support for perception capabilities on DARPA/DoD funded autonomous navigation efforts

The following qualifications are required:  

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, electrical or mechanical engineering, or related technical discipline with a minimum of 6 years of directly applicable experience; Master’s degree in similar disciplines with a minimum of 4 years of experience; or PhD in similar disciplines

  • Thorough understanding of computer vision and perception methods, ideally with implementation experience on fielded robots and systems

  • Strong software skills in C/C++ with demonstrable track record of working on complex projects

  • Strong communication skills with the ability to document clearly

  • Strong teamwork skills

The following qualifications are desired:

  • Graduate degree in computer science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering or related

Demonstrated experience in developing perception capabilities for robotic vehicles

    JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

    For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
